info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 2 at 4:49PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee FL
info.description:
At 449 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Tallahassee State College, moving southeast at 25 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects.
Locations impacted include... Tallahassee, Woodville, Tallahassee State College, Florida State University, Florida A and M, Doak Campbell Stadium, Lake Bradford, Macon Community Park, Miccosukee Road Greenway, Gaither Community Center, Lake Munson, Tallahassee Memorial Hosp, Walker Ford Community Center, South City, Eight Mile Pond, Griffin Heights, Fred George Park, Lake Ella, Callen Neighborhood, and State Capital Complex.
info.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

parameter.value: A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT CENTRAL LEON COUNTY THROUGH 530 PM EDT
